image.altText: A winding road in the community, surrounded by houses and power poles.

items.synopsis: Inadequate training led a Northern Territory police officer to recommend a dangerous domestic violence offender be released on bail three days before he killed his partner, the NT coroner has heard.

title.children: Police officer apologises for recommending bail for DV offender days before killing, inquest hears

image.altText: An aerial shot of Groote Eylandt, beaches can be seen bellow.

items.synopsis: Initial reports indicate six people were on board, with four being taken to local clinics in serious conditions.

title.children: Plane crashes while attempting to land on Groote Eylandt

image.altText: Harry Brook holds his bat aloft as the ball hits the stumps, while Alex Carey and Marnus Labuschagne celebrate

items.synopsis: Australia's bowlers strike after lunch to take control of the first day of the first Ashes Test at Edgbaston. Follow all the action from day one in our live blog.

title.children: Aussie bowlers up for the challenge as England attacks on day one of the Ashes

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: The start of that session was all Australia, with the wickets of Harry Brook and Ben Stokes in quick succession adding to the pre-lunch scalp of Zak Crawley. But Joe Root is looking in imperious form, and now Jonny Bairstow's getting into his work. This partnership could do just about anything, so the Aussie bowlers can't let up at all in the final session.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: Tea: England 5-240 (Root 66, Bairstow 33)

props.alt: England batter Jonny Bairstow hits a powerful cricket shot.

children.content: The start of that session was all Australia, with the wickets of Harry Brook and Ben Stokes in quick succession adding to the pre-lunch scalp of Zak Crawley.

But Joe Root is looking in imperious form, and now Jonny Bairstow's getting into his work. This partnership could do just about anything, so the Aussie bowlers can't let up at all in the final session.

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: Ben Stokes burns a review, because there is a faint edge on the snickometer. Not a great shot, but live by the sword and all that. Hazlewood is living up to his selection with a second scalp, and it's a massive one.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: The England captain has to go!

children.content: Ben Stokes burns a review, because there is a faint edge on the snickometer.
Not a great shot, but live by the sword and all that.
Hazlewood is living up to his selection with a second scalp, and it's a massive one.

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: Brook looks to turn Nathan Lyon to leg again and the ball balloons up off his pad. Everyone loses sight of it and, after what seems like an age, the ball finally returns from orbit to land in the batting box and trickle onto the stumps.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: Harry Brook is bowled in farcical circumstances!

children.content: Brook looks to turn Nathan Lyon to leg again and the ball balloons up off his pad. Everyone loses sight of it and, after what seems like an age, the ball finally returns from orbit to land in the batting box and trickle onto the stumps.

props.alt: England batter Harry Brook looks back at his broken stumps.

image.altText: an aerial photo of a train crash

items.synopsis: Katherine residents detail the dramatic scene they witnessed after a freight train collided with a truck on the outskirts of town earlier this week.

title.children: Train derailment rocks Katherine residents who helped rescue injured crew

image.altText: A photo of a gas exploration project. The image is taken by a drone and shows a busy mine.

items.synopsis: The Supreme Court has ruled that the owners of Beetaloo Station are not owed compensation before gas exploration takes place.

title.children: Beetaloo Station owners lose fracking compensation appeal

image.altText: Gino Mader

items.synopsis: Swiss rider Gino Mäder has died after crashing into a ravine on the descent towards the finish line in Thursday's stage five of the Tour de Suisse, his team Bahrain Victorious said on Friday.

title.children: Cyclist Gino Mäder dies after ravine crash during stage five of the Tour de Suisse

image.altText: A middle-aged man with one eye swollen shut, a cut on his nose and eye bruising. He is wearing a neck brace.

items.synopsis: Jim Cullen's ordeal was not over when help finally arrived after a crash in the NT that left his mates fearing for his life. Rather than an emergency airlift, he then had to endure a 60km trip along a rough dirt road to an airstrip.

title.children: Motorcyclist's six-hour wait in 'absolute agony' sparks push for more outback airstrips

image.altText: Female hands holding a mobile phone with a dark background.

items.synopsis: Claire Harrison says she's still recovering from losing her identity and tens of thousands of dollars by mobile porting fraud, where scammers port your mobile number to another device.

title.children: 'Terrifying' phone porting scam stealing millions but cybersecurity experts say it's unavoidable

image.altText: Peter Dutton in the prime minister's courtyard

items.synopsis: Peter Dutton says he was made aware of another allegation against senator David Van and that he should quit parliament, following claims made by senator Lidia Thorpe and former senator Amanda Stoker in recent days.

title.children: Peter Dutton says senator David Van should quit parliament, after another allegation raised with him

image.altText: Liberal Senator David Van

items.synopsis: Two women ended up in tears in the Senate this week, as the Brittany Higgins imbroglio exploded yet again and in the process claimed a scalp, writes Michelle Grattan.

title.children: A spectacular fall as Liberals chase the uncatchable

image.altText: A large white church is pictured with men in suits walking in front of it carrying candles.

items.synopsis: Air raid sirens blare and at least two explosions rock Kyiv as African leaders begin a peace mission, hoping to mediate between Ukraine and Russia.

title.children: Explosions rattle Kyiv as African leaders on peace mission visit Ukraine

image.altText: Rock thrown at bus transporting school children

items.synopsis: An Alice Springs tour operator is calling for action and "accountability" after one of his buses was hit by a rock while transferring more than 100 Melbourne-based school children to the airport.

title.children: Alice Springs tour operator's bus damaged after rock thrown at convoy carrying students

image.altText: An Aboriginal man holds his hands under a tap

items.synopsis: The Northern Territory government has released its first water plan, which will receive $13.5 million for its implementation over three years.

title.children: Northern Territory's first water plan targets safe drinking water for remote communities

image.altText: Three Aboriginal kids in school uniforms stand in front of a science display

items.synopsis: Students from the remote Northern Territory homeland of Nganambala are using space-inspired technology to design infrastructure for their community.

title.children: In this remote community, there is no phone reception. These kids are working to change that

image.altText: A house with a sold sign out the front.

items.synopsis: A couple bought the home in 2018 at a mortgagee auction, but after a five-year legal battle found they never actually owned it. Today, it sold for more than double the previous sale price.

title.children: Gold Coast house at centre of complex legal dispute over ownership sells for $2.66m at auction

image.altText: A man with a hat stands on top of a rock

items.synopsis: A Supreme Court trial that heard evidence from a self-professed prophet and featured a gun demonstration has ended in the acquittal of a man accused of murdering his childhood friend.

title.children: Man acquitted of fatally shooting 'best mate' after drinking session deteriorates

image.altText: Meghan (left) and Harry (right)

items.synopsis: A multi-million-dollar deal between streaming giant Spotify and a media group run by Prince Harry and his wife Meghan has ended by mutual agreement, according to the two parties.

title.children: Harry and Meghan's $29m Spotify deal ends after one podcast series

items.synopsis: A McDonald's manager who was punched and spat on by a customer tells the Adelaide Magistrates Court he still has flashbacks of the incident and has to attend therapy sessions.

title.children: 'Absolutely disgusted': Victims of McDonald's 'rampage' tell court of trauma

image.altText: A young Brisbane Lions AFL player kicks the ball towards goal as a Sydney defender trails behind him.

items.synopsis: Brisbane Lions dominate the second half to earn a vital win at the Gabba — but poor goalkicking keeps it close against the Swans.

title.children: Lions hold on to take vital win over the Swans at the Gabba

image.altText: A man celebrates as he scores a try in a rugby league match

items.synopsis: North Queensland's match against Penrith might have run 88 minutes but Scott Drinkwater's golden point try was more than worth the wait.

title.children: Scott Drinkwater stunner seals golden point win for North Queensland over Penrith

image.altText: A black and white photo of a topless person from their right side.

items.synopsis: A straightforward portrait of artist Emma Armstrong-Porter with "a lot of stuff going on" underneath its simplicity is selected as this year's National Photographic Portrait Prize winner.

title.children: 'Simple' photo taken in a home studio wins 2023 National Photographic Portrait Prize

image.altText: Four young children smiling and laughing

items.synopsis: Charmaine Harris McLeod's ex-husband James McLeod said in a victim impact statement he was "broken" and "gutted", and now riddled with anxiety every time he saw an oncoming truck.

title.children: Ex-husband of woman who died alongside four children in truck crash says he feels 'no purpose in life anymore'

image.altText: A jawless fish showing its oral disc and teeth.

items.synopsis: They may have a scary face and feast off the blood of their fellow fish, but conservationists say it's great news to see this prehistoric fish in our waterways.

title.children: Rare, prehistoric, toothy and jaw-less fish spotted in popular Limestone Coast swimming spot

image.altText: The outside of the County Court of Victoria building.

items.synopsis: Former Victoria Police officer Mario Didulica, who sexually abused a 14-year-old girl and tried to convince her to elope to France with him, could be released from prison next year.

title.children: Former police officer who planned elopement to France with 14yo girl jailed for three years

image.altText: An elderly man wearing a suit

items.synopsis: Max Hazelton is remembered as a man who "broke a few rules", provided regional Australians with access to air travel and survived six days lost after a crash in NSW, at a memorial service in Orange attended by hundreds.

title.children: Aviation 'pioneer' who once travelled in the luggage hold of a booked-out commercial flight farewelled

image.altText: A woman in a high vis vest standing near a group of similarly dressed people.

items.synopsis: Applicants for permanent Business Innovation and Investment Programme (BIIP) visas, or subclass 888 visas, hold demonstrations in Sydney and Melbourne, calling for the government to speed up processing of their permanent residency.

title.children: 'A matter of fairness': 'Golden ticket' visa holders protest against permanent residency processing time

image.altText: A blonde, middle-aged woman stands behind the podium in the White House's press briefing room, gesturing as she speaks.

items.synopsis: The new victims add to a growing list of entities in the US, Britain and other countries whose systems were infiltrated through the MOVEit Transfer software.

title.children: US energy department, other federal agencies hit in global hacking spree

image.altText: LIz Indrans

items.synopsis: A report by Swinburne University of Technology found 10 companies that trialled a four-day work week continued it after a pilot, with four organisations adopting the change permanently.

title.children: These employers have introduced four-day work weeks and 'can't think of a downside'

image.altText: A the back of a whale floating in the ocean, trees on a riverbank behind.

items.synopsis: Researchers investigate whether the world's first heritage whale site is equipped to welcome a growing population, as a whale dies near Hervey Bay.

title.children: Humpback whale stranded off Queensland coast dies, citizen scientists called to monitor population

image.altText: a man wearing dark glasses holding a smoke and leaning up against a car

items.synopsis: The father of a mentally ill man who was fatally shot by police in country New South Wales says he could have de-escalated the situation if officers had alerted him.

title.children: Father tells inquest police scared son 'like caged animal' before fatal shooting

image.altText: A man stands in front of a lectern.

items.synopsis: Upon handing down a year-long jail term, a County Court judge has described Ballarat real estate agent Richard Hayden, who embezzled nearly $800,000 from clients, as a man of "otherwise unblemished character".

title.children: Real estate agent who stole from clients to fund good end-of-life for wife jailed

image.altText: Aerial photo of the surf break at Snapper Rocks

items.synopsis: A remarkable feat of engineering is the secret to the Gold Coast's iconic surf break.

title.children: Is the Gold Coast's Superbank a miracle of mother nature or a masterpiece of human engineering?
